page.title: 05WIGMORE HALL
page.content: WIGMORE HALL Wigmore Hall was originally erected about 1480, probably at the instigation of Edward IV. As Edward, Duke of York, he had inherited the Honour and Lordship of Wygmore, Wygmore Boro, and Wygmore Forine (Foreign) on the death of his father, Richard, Duke of York, at the battle of Wakefield during the Wars of the Roses. Richard had previously inherited the estates from his mother, Anne Mortimer, who married Richard Plantagenet, Earl of Cambridge. A replica of a Plantagenet mural was discovered behind some Tudor panelling in 1913, commemorating the Battle of Mortimer's Cross in 1461, the outcome of which put the House of York on the Throne.
